properties.name: Carter's Apartment
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanThis is where my friend Carter lives. I stayed there in the summer of 2006 while they went to Canada. What a view from this place.

properties.name: Chester's Store
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanNuff said.

properties.name: Coalition for the Homeless Meeting Spot
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanThis is where we meet the vans to distribute food to the homeless. It\'s right next to St. Bart\'s.

properties.name: Comic Artist friend lived here
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanMy friend Gerry Porter lived here and I spent many a night drinking tea and drawing comics.

properties.name: Downtown Comics
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanThe best comic book store in Newfoundland. The others are all run by Comic Book Guy clones.

properties.name: Favourite Whale Watching Spot
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanThis was one of my favourite places to watch whales from on Cape Spear. Linda was the first person to show me this site. We spent many wonderful hours making tea in the outdoors and watching whales together.

properties.name: First Place I arrived in New York
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanI arrived by bus in 1983 and was let loose here at the then infamous Port Authority Bus Terminal.

properties.name: First Place I lived in New York
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanI spent a month at Sloane House YMCA in the winter and fall of 1983.

properties.name: First Time I was ever frisked by a cop
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanIt was in 1983 and I\'m sure he was mistaken. I was clean of course.

properties.name: First place I stepped into the Pacific Ocean
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanIn the summer of 2006, I took a train around America. This was the first place that I put my foot into the Pacific Ocean.

properties.name: Former Hill Top
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanWe used to slide and ski down this hill. Not any more.

properties.name: Furthest North I've been on the Island
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanThis is around a town I visited with Jeff in the 1980\'s.

properties.name: Furthest West I've Been in Canada
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanI visited Winnipeg in the spring of 1978 as part of a student exchange with St. Pauls High School in Tuxedo. First place I ever seen desert size sand dunes.

properties.name: Goodbye to Linda
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanAfter Linda\'s funeral mass, we held a public memorial here at the Gazebo in Bannerman Park. Les came up with the idea and we released 43 balloons into the air. This was good-bye. I was never as proud of Les as that afternoon as she spoke to the crowd.

properties.name: Great Grandmothers House
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanThis was where our great grandmother\'s house was located. She was the oldest person I\'ve ever met in my life. Probably at least 100.

properties.name: Honeymoon 1997
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanOn August 1, 1997 Linda and I walked to this remote spot in the dark and spent our first night as man and wife sleeping on the side of Signal Hill. We woke to a beautiful sunrise over the Atlantic Ocean. We were madly in love.

properties.name: Jessica's Apartment
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanI spent quite a few nights here in the fall of 2006. We broke up in the late fall.

properties.name: Last Stop on Railabout
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanChicago was the last stop on my Railabout tour of 2006.

properties.name: Linda's Funeral
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanLinda\'s funeral mass took place the Friday after she died here at the Anglican Cathedral.

properties.name: Lunch in Saratoga Springs
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanI stopped here twice in 1983 for lunch on my way to New York City.

properties.name: Mom's House
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanThis is where my Mom lives with her cat, Boo. I love my Mom.

properties.name: Moo Moos
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanMoo Moo\'s Dairy Bar, 88 Kings Road. This establishment is owned by my family and they manufacture their own ice cream on location. It\'s considered to be the best ice cream parlour in the province.

properties.name: My Brother Gerard's House
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanThis is the house of the eldest Ryan brother and his family.

properties.name: My Brother Jeff's Place
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanThis is where Jeff lives and we hang out a lot.

properties.name: My Brother Rob's House
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanThis is where my next oldest brother Rob lives with his family.

properties.name: My Dad's House
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanThis is where my Dad lives with his wife, Margaret. You can see his car in the driveway. I was born on my fathers 30th birthday and was named after him.

properties.name: My First Comic Book Con 1998
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanThe Rosemount Convention Center where I went to the WizardWorld 98.

properties.name: My Sister Lizas House
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanThis is not only where she lives but it was where my high school girlfriend, Linda Heale grew up. I touched my first breast in this house.

properties.name: My home
properties.description: Posted by Wallaceryan111 Military Road. My daughter lives here. We\'ve lived there since 1997. The house is more than a 100 years old.

properties.name: Port aux Basques
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanI got the ferry here to the mainland a couple of times.

properties.name: Returning to NYC
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanI used to go to Buffalo Airport to get People\'s Express to New York during the 1980\'s.

properties.name: Sacred Place
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanThis is a place that Linda and I used to go for tea and also to watch for whales. The day we found out that she only had less than a month to live, we went out there for what was to be the final time. We sat and cried as we looked out over the ocean. It was one of the saddest moments I ever spent at this sacred spot of ours.

properties.name: Second Family Home
properties.description: Posted by Wallaceryan 2 McNeilly Street. This was the second house I ever lived in. We moved there when I was 5 or 6 and my fater finally sold it in the mid-90\'s

properties.name: Second Stop on Railabout
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanSavannah was my second stop on my Railabout. I stopped here because I liked the name. It was a cool place.

properties.name: Site of Mt. Cashel Orphanage
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanThe site of a sexual abuse scandal the orphanage was closed and torn down. I swam at the swimming pool there as a child.

properties.name: Stop over in 1998
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanI stopped in Ottawa for a few hours in 1998 on my way to Chicago. The Parliament Buildings look so much more impressive in real life.

properties.name: Studio I shared with MANL
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanThis was the location of a studio I rented from MANL. I met Ronan there and had sex with woman there back when I was a bad boy.

properties.name: Studio I shared with Ronan
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanI shared a studio here in the 1980\'s with Ronan Kennedy.

properties.name: Summer Vacation 1960's
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanAt Green Acres. I was really young.

properties.name: Summer Vacation Early 1970's
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanGreat beach. Found a plane wreck in the woods.

properties.name: The Furthest North I've Been
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanThis is Happy Valley-Goose Bay. I was there in November, 2005 for the Labrador Creative Arts festival. What a great time I had there. The people are amazing.

properties.name: The Furthest South I've Been
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanI stayed at the Clay Hotel here in the summer of 2006. I love Miami Beach. SUN....ahhhh. I can still feel it.

properties.name: The first house I lived in
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanThis is the house in which I first lived. It was my favourite house growing up and I hated to leave it. But our parents wanted us to go to the newer Catholic school so we moved to McNeilly Street. i actually know the 2 families that lived there after us.

properties.name: The house Linda grew up in
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanThis was Park Place. A beautiful place that made Linda into the wonderful person she was...

properties.name: The site of the OCA Studio-1983-84
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanThis is where i went to school from 1983 to 1984. Myself, my friend Carter and a dozen more art students shared this beautiful loft with Coordinator Dan Soloman and our cat, Sidney.

properties.name: Where I First got Drunk
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanI got drunk when I was 15 or 16 with a friend of mine. We drank vodka and oranger juice.

properties.name: Where I arrive in the USA
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanI always enter the USA by jet at Newark Liberty Airport.

properties.name: Where I first arrived in Washinton
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanThis was the first stop on my 2006 Railabout of America.

properties.name: Where I first attended University
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanThis is Memorial University or MUN as it is called. I went to First Year in 1979-1980. I wirked on the newspaper, the Muse with many friends.

properties.name: Where I first kissed Linda
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanI first kissed my late wife Linda behind these buildings in 1986. We never dated each other until 1995 and married in 197.

properties.name: Where I first lived in Toronto
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanThis is NeillWycick. A coop student residence that I lived in during my first year at art school. I was roommates with a great guy named Carl Laporte. I haven\'t heard from him in years. He was a sweet person and I miss him.

properties.name: Where I first met Linda and Leslie
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanI first met my late wife Linda and our daughter Les in 1984 in a friends apartment in this house. She was wearing a white skirt. I loved her from the first time I seen her.

properties.name: Where I first smoked Pot
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanI was 15 years old when I first smoked pot on the side of this building, Parkdale Pharmacy.

properties.name: Where I first stayed in Montreal
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanThis was where my girlfriend, Adrienne first lived when she moved to Montreal in 1980. I would take a train from Toronto and spend weekends with her. Montreal is truly a magical city.

properties.name: Where I first stayed in New Orleans
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanThis is India House. It was one of the wildest places I stayed during my train trip of 2006. I loved the place! Full of character and characters.

properties.name: Where I first went to College
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanAt the time it was called the College of Trades and Technology or simply, the Trades School. I attended the Commercial Art course in 1978-1979. I also returned there in 2000-2002 to do the Graphic Design course. I have also taught Design at the school.

properties.name: Where I got out during my Railabout 2006
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanI bought a blanket here.

properties.name: Where I like to eat Breakfast
properties.description: Posted by Wallaceryan This is the Cup n Saucer. It is a diner just down the street from me that I like to eat my breakfast in. I usually order the egg n ham sandwich.

properties.name: Where I live In New York in 2007
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanThis is 1 Orchard Street where I am right now as I map my life on Platial. It is the studio of my friend, Carter Kustera. I went to the Ontario College of Art with Carter and spent a year with him at the OCA Off Campus Studio in New York in 1983-1984.

properties.name: Where I lived in Brooklyn
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanIn 1983 I lived in Brooklyn in Crown Heights.

properties.name: Where I lived in Queens
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanThis is where I lived in 1984 in Queens with my roommate, Ted Dudas. We had a scream. The landlady, Mrs. Deluca was a sweetheart. When we first rented the apartment there was still fingerprint dust all over the place. It\'s a long story. I visited the building in 2006 and it still looks the same.

properties.name: Where I lived the longest in Toronto
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanThis is 13 Prospect Street where I rented a room for more than a year in 1981-1982.

properties.name: Where I lost my Virginity
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanIn the sweet summer of 1979, I lost my virginity to my first love, Adrienne on a warm summer afternoon in a tent. It was in a park called Butterpot. I\'ll never forget that afternoon. I was 19 years old.

properties.name: Where I teach Comic Books and Cartooning
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanThis is the Anna Templeton Centre where I\'ve taught Comic Books and Cartooning for over 10 years.

properties.name: Where I was First Mugged
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanIn the winter of 1983 I was mugged in the Clinton-Washington subway station. I lived but the muggers were arrested almost immediately by an off-duty police officer.

properties.name: Where I was born
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanThe Grace Hospital. Now abandoned and quite possibly to be torn down.

properties.name: Where I went to Art School
properties.description: Posted by Wallaceryan  This is the Ontario College of Art and Design (formerly the Ontario College of Art) where I went from 1980 to 1984. I graduated in 1985. It was the most magical and insane time of my life.

properties.name: Where I went to Grade School
properties.description: Posted by Wallaceryan This is the former St. Pius X Boys School. It was run by Irish Christian Brothers and was an all-boys school when I went there. Some of the brothers who taught there were later convicted in the notorious Mt. Cashel Orphanage Sexual Abuse Scandal for sexually abusing young boys in their care.

properties.name: Where I went to High School
properties.description: Posted by Wallaceryan This is Gonzaga High School where I went from 1976 to 1978. I hated it. The only saving grace was Drama Club when we got to team up with the drama club of Holy Heart Girls School.

properties.name: Where I went to Kindergarden
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanThis is the former St. Pius X Girls School. I went there for kindergarden and then finished my schooling at the Boys School which was constructed below it on Elizabeth Avenue.

properties.name: Where Les went to School
properties.description: Posted by Wallaceryan This is the school where Les went for primary. She was such a good student.

properties.name: Where Linda Died
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanLinda passed away here on July 4th, 2005. It was the saddest moment in my life. She was only 43 years old.

properties.name: Where Linda and I first lived together
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanThis is the house on Bannerman Street where I first moved in and lived with Linda and Leslie. The two years we all spent together was the most wondeful time in my life. We became a family in that apartment.

properties.name: Where Linda and I were Married
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanThis is the spot on which I married my beloved Linda Friday,August 1st, 1997 at the stroke of 5pm. It was one of the happiest moments of my life.

properties.name: Where Linda was Born
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanLinda was born here. I was there as a kid in the 60\'s

properties.name: Where Linda's grave is located
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanThis is where my late wife, Linda\'s grave is located. I cannot visit there without crying. Ironically, her parents live right across the street. I miss her terribly so.

properties.name: Where Linda, Les and I got our first Christmas tree
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanIt was 1995 and we seen a rabbit while looking for a tree to cut. This land was sold to a company that began to tear down the mountain for gravel. Have a look up this road.

properties.name: Where my Comic Book Store was located
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanThis is the location of the Daily Planet, a comic book store I owned in the early 1990\'s.

properties.name: Where my Sister Ruth lives
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanThis is my friend Ian Carter\'s house where my sister Ruth lives.

properties.name: Where my T-Shirts are made
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanThis is the studio of Living Planet T-Shirts. This is where the shirts are silk screened. My boss Dave Hopley, also lives above the workshop. He\'s my favourite freelance client.

properties.name: Where our Cabin is located
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanThis is Middle Gull Pond where we have had a cabin since I was a small child. Some of my happiest moments in my life happened here.

properties.name: the Happiest Moment in my Life
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanThe night after we got married, Linda and I walked home from the movies. It was August 2nd, 1997 and I can\'t think of a more single beautifully happy moment that we spent together. I love her still.

properties.name: the Russian Baths
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanI was introduced to the Russian baths by Carter. I also met Jessica here. I love going for a nice steam.

properties.name: the Saddest Moment of my Life
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanThe morning after Linda died, July 5th. 2005, I walked down the parking lot with the clothes Linda was to be buried in. I started to cry and it felt like my heart was breaking apart inside of me. It was the saddest moment of my life.

properties.name: the Ship Inne
properties.description: Posted by WallaceryanI had many a memorable night at the Ship Inne. It was sold a few years ago and renamed the Ship Pub. An institution for years in the arts community.
